intro: Gomphrena pulchella var. haenkeana, commonly known as the pink plume or red plume, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is characterized by its distinctive, feathery inflorescences that range in color from pink to deep red. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. It is an annual or biennial herb with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The showy flowers attract pollinators like bees and butterflies, making it a valuable addition to native gardens.
